availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nicholas T. Berry (Marion County, Kentucky, circuit clerk.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, circuit clerk. Kentucky, native. Married to Josephine Boucher Berry. Father of Samuel B. Berry. Married to Nannie H. Phillips Berry in Marion County on March 16, 1858. Clerk in Marion County in 1850. Circuit clerk in Marion County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Household owned an additional enslaved person in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 399A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 738.
Eigth Manuscript Census of the United States(1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Marion, District 2, p. 499A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Marriages.
"Nicholas T Berry, in Marion County," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), April 21, 1882, p. 2.
"Nicholas T. Berry (1825-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial #41525608 , accessed August 31, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41525608/nicholas-t-berry.
